intro: Parathesis costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican parathesis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds.
